185991981.review:
tl;dr
Rain World is a hellish game filled with lots of trial and error and will challenge your patience regularly. Yet those who persevere will discover perhaps the most unique and engaging exploration game out there.

[h1]Full Review[/h1]
I found this game through my wife’s obsession with its lore. I tried it out and quickly became frustrated with its difficulty, but it sat at the back of my mind until I played again. I still got frustrated, but I was doing better. And still I repeated this process. Now, 100+ hours in, the game still manages to annoy me sometimes…and yet there’s nothing quite like the feeling of curiosity and adventure it gives. That’s what keeps bringing me back to Rain World.

Gameplay:
Rain World has a high learning curve. You are tossed into the game after a brief cutscene, taught the basic mechanics of controls, eating food to survive, and finding shelter from the titular rain before the end of each cycle. After that, there’s next to no instruction, and you’re left to wander around and figure everything else out yourself.
One of the most curious features in Rain World that you’ll quickly notice is the other nonplayer creatures. Rather than being traditional video game enemies and whatnot, they behave more like animals in an environment simulation, traveling around the region and doing things on their own accord. Some are passive toward you, while others become aggressive and need to be foiled in order for you to survive.
Which leads to another key point: your character is small, weak, and delicious, and your abilities are limited. Besides the low-damage spears you can find scattered around, there’s very few consistent methods to fight back against dangerous creatures. As such, you instead must learn how to outsmart, outplay, and outmaneuver anything that wants to eat or kill you. Along with survival, platforming skills and devious wit become imperative for progression. This is where a lot of the unfairness comes into play, as during some cycles it will just feel like everything is working against you. It can work the opposite way as well, however, as random situations or thinking outside the box can lead to unexpected solutions for moving forward. Such a fascinatingly random environment is both this game’s biggest annoyance, and greatest reward.

Story:
Rather than a traditional linear story, Rain World is more of an anthology of its own ingame world, told through the small and comparatively insignificant struggles of each character’s campaign. Even then, little of that lore is given to you directly, but rather must be gleaned from piecing together environmental clues or dialogue from ancient beings. This form of storytelling fits well with the game, making you once again feel like just a small critter in a world that lives on, with or without you. Those who can figure out Rain World’s lore will find it unique and fascinating. Don’t worry, I won’t spoil any of it!

Visuals:
This is another section where Rain World stands out from other games. The graphics are clearly pixelated yet highly detailed, playing well to the visual storytelling I mentioned earlier. Each creature, including yourself, is actually procedurally-animated, causing them to move even more lifelike…usually. Sometimes the procedural animation can glitch and create some humorous results, haha. Even still, the graphics and procedural animation in particular are often a wonderous sight to behold.

Music:
I’m normally not good at saying much for this section but holy hecc does Rain World leave an impression here. The soundtrack is absolutely a perfect match for this game. Much of the music almost feels diegetic as you explore, and the dynamic threat music for whenever danger is nearby fits the riskiness of each encounter.
But what sticks out in particular to me is the main theme. Along with the title screen version, it plays in three other variants throughout your adventure. It’s such a simple tune, yet the more I’ve learned about Rain World’s lore, the more I feel it perfectly encapsulates the game world’s themes and condition. It is hauntingly beautiful, and almost nostalgic in a way. Very few soundtracks can get me emotional in the same way.

Replay Value:
Although the game’s world stays the same for each given campaign, the high randomness factor and generally nonlinear exploration make Rain World a great game to play over and over. Many secrets lay hidden throughout each campaign, and even without, there’s plenty of fun to be had in challenging yourself to different completion methods or scores.

In conclusion, Rain World is a highly unique exploration game experience that is really worth a look. Thanks to its high learning curve, this game unfortunately might not be for everyone, especially if you get frustrated easily. But those who are looking to try something new, and are willing to use a bit of patience, will find this game unforgettable.

185931205.review:
I've never written a review for a game before, but Rain World is special. 
I have a lot to say (mostly about the movement, creatures, rooms, and soundtrack), but I suppose the long and short of it is that Rain World is sincerely my favorite game of all time and a very formidable candidate for my favorite piece of media ever made. (This review will be inherently biased as a result!) If you have not played Rain World, fix that immediately. If you do not like Rain World, I don't like you. It really is that simple. 


The most important aspect of any game is the gameplay. I've always enjoyed 2D platformers, but nothing feels quite like Rain World does. This game's movement seems to be hit or miss for a lot of people, but frankly I don't believe that's because its design is questionable or its execution is unsatisfying. The movement (and, by extension, the moment-to-moment gameplay) becomes extremely fun the moment you learn how it works, a philosophy that applies to the vast majority of the game. The controls are not intuitive or snappy, but they are extremely enjoyable. Beyond this, the game offers many different movesets and playstyles through the different Slugcats as well. The game's environments and creatures also offer such an amazing jungle gym in which to experiment with said movement, and when all these forces combine, the game on a bare-bones level is already very fun on its own. 

This is not to say that either the creatures or environments are a backdrop to the central gameplay either; both the rooms and creatures themselves are also near-flawlessly made. The creatures are almost unbelievably dynamic and "real" feeling. The AI that drives each creature works amazingly the majority of the time, with only a handful of creatures failing to work properly on a relatively consistent basis; namely, the Miros Birds and Raindeer. I don't know a thing about programming, so I can't explain how it works or why, only that it does, and that the game is so much better for it. No creature is made without a place on the food web in mind or a specific function within the game's general mechanics. The amount of care put into the living fauna of the game is truly staggering, and I've only come to appreciate it more the more I've played the game. It's also worth mentioning here that the game as a whole treats you as a Slugcat the exact same way it treats other creatures. There is no handholding involved, rather, the game expects you to experiment in any given situation, and eventually you will begin to thrive. Creatures are not made on a predator/prey basis (despite the trailer, lol). They exist only to help illuminate the artificial ecosystem within the game.

The visual design of Rain World is legitimately my favorite artistic style in any game and it isn't even close, specifically when discussing the rooms. The lighting, colors, graffiti, grime, and things like ambient bugs or clouds make this the most atmospheric and immersive game I've ever played without even considering the soundtrack. Much like programming, I also know nothing about visual art because I suck at it completely. All I can say is that the game's visual style is so well-crafted that any given screen could very easily be seen out of context in an art exhibit of some kind and be highly appreciated regardless. Even the darker regions like SC or SB look beautiful when illuminated by in-game light sources. I also really enjoy the look of most creatures in the game, as they all have unique designs that compliment their personalities and behaviors, and even are lore-relevant in some cases. I do think many of the lizards are quite drab when compared to other creatures, though. 

The environments and visual flair of the game would be cool and pleasant on their own, but they all happen to be accompanied by a strikingly beautiful soundtrack and some truly amazing ambient sound work. I'll get my only complaint out of the way first: I just don't like the threat themes at all. I would have them turned off permanently if I could. I don't like them. Unfortunately, there is no way to turn them off without eliminating all the music, which would be bad. I don't like the threat themes. I hope I've made myself clear. That being said, the rest of the soundtrack sort of flows in and out of the game like a gentle breeze, only popping in at specific landmarks within the game to allow for maximum symbiosis. Coming from a guy that mostly listens to Black Metal and Deathgrind, this game's music is inexplicably gorgeous (and personally moving). No other game, movie, or book has ever brought me to tears, but Rain World has done so with just its music many times. If you can't afford to play the game or just aren't that interested, at least take the time to listen to the soundtrack. 
I have less to say about the ambient sound stuff, only that it works so well literally all of the time that it's almost unnoticeable unless you're paying really close attention. It takes the overgrown wastelands this game occupies and brings them to live masterfully. It is truly, genuinely impressive. 

Some people care about the stories of their games. I've watched my fair share of lore videos on YouTube to try to learn about the story, and the general consensus seems to be that it's quite good. I've enjoyed what I've read about or learned in the game, but honestly, it just doesn't matter to me that much. The best it could be is engrossing, the worst it could be is serviceable. 


I understand that this review doesn't read like most other game reviews (at least, not the ones I've seen) but with how much I love this game and the amount of time I've spent on it, a review kind of felt necessary. Rain World is a one of a kind, lightning-in-a-bottle type game for me. It's one of those things where even the flaws only serve to make the game better. Whether or not that's the case for you is another question, but if you're anything like me, this game is a MUST play. Even if Rain World isn't typically your style, I definitely recommend at least giving it a shot. It's well worth the time and money even if it doesn't mesh with you right away. 

All this in mind, Rain World is absolutely something I recommend. 
Also, sorry for the long read, I promise I tried my best :)

185900846.review:
This is easily one of the best games I've ever played, if not the best.

When the game starts, you have absolutely no idea what you're in for. You're completely on your own from the beginning. You learn how to move, eat, sleep and that's it. You just explore around, survive, and avoid predators (eventually). As you explore more and more, you realize how well the game makes you feel like you're just part of the ecosystem, like a mere slugcat trying to survive like any other creature. Rain World is difficult. You'll learn through trial and error. By observing, experimenting, dying.

The beginning is incredibly harsh, but trust me, it's worth it. Once you get the hang of it and progress further in the game, Rain World unveils all of its amazing story, mechanics, and soundtrack. You're driven by a desire to gain knowledge and keep going. The game gave me feelings I can't explain. I was in awe at every discovery, every time I finally understood something. The feeling of reward is unmatched. The uncaring ecosystem is remarkable, creating constant tension during the gameplay. Theses moments are amplified by the soundtrack blending in perfectly with the beautiful environments.

The game does have its flaws, but in my opinion, the experience Rain World offers is undoubtedly worth it.
The new DLC extends the game's life even further and you can add mods via the workshop.
Play the game, and remember, you will die and get frustrated. However Rain World reveals its beauty to those who persevere.

Rain World is a game I adored from the very beggining, not only because of its difficulty, as the game is very hard at first, but because the game provided something I didn't see before. Obviously, even though the point of this game is, well, survive, you also have an objective. I'm not going to say what it is, because it's your duty to figure it out, but I can only say it is wonderful.

To talk a little about the DLC, it's enourmous the amount of work everyone put on it, and it really paid off, because the amount of story, lore and new mechanics the DLC provides is amazing. You are really missing out if you don't get the DLC.

I hope you can have a wonderful experience as I had with this game.

Мне очень нравится эта игра и ее история.
Начнем с очевидного. 
Мне здесь понравилась атмосфера древнего и брошенного своими создателями мира (мега структуры), что стал жить и развиваться своей жизнью.
Мне нравиться звуковой дизайн локаций и разных других событий, боя, спокойствия, тревоги, звуки были подставлены идеально а сама музыка заслуживает быть у каждого в альбоме.
Стоит отметить, что история о древних и о великом цикле была очень интересным, и вполне удачным решением.
Локации интересно изучать, попадая в различные ситуации, как внезапный прилет стервятников, попадая на один маршрут с разведчиками мусорщиков, или нахождение новых зон и локаций.
Игра очень продумана и имеет очень много разных механик (которые вы вряд ли будете делать или о которых вообще будете знать).

Но это мне не помешало насладиться этой игрой.
Спасибо за игру.


I really like this game and its story.
Let's start with the obvious.
I liked the atmosphere of the ancient and abandoned by its creators world (mega structure), which began to live and develop its own life.
I like the sound design of locations and various other events, combat, calm, anxiety, the sounds were perfectly set up and the music itself deserves to be in everyone's album. It is worth noting that the story of the ancients and the great cycle was a very interesting and quite successful solution.
Locations are interesting to explore, getting into various situations, like the sudden arrival of vultures, getting on the same route with scavenger scouts, or finding new zones and locations.
The game is very thoughtful and has a lot of different mechanics (which you are unlikely to do or even know about). There are also disadvantages like difficulty and a small number of hints about our cat's abilities, like somersaults, flips, and his other abilities.
But that didn't stop me from enjoying this game.
Thanks for playing.

185790761.review:
I love this game! The music and art style is especially amazing, it certainly is challenging but if you are patient and determined, and love exploration, and discovery, this certainly will be an exciting and especially rewarding after all those frustrations.

This game's visual and audio presentation definitely made me feel the emotions, from awe, to sadness, melancholy and dread, like existential dread sort of feeling. It is counter intuitive but I actually like the feeling of existential dread and hear me out, because I never really felt such thing and this game allows me to experience such emotion, which makes me appreciate the game even more. It made me feel so insignificant and reflective of the sheer powerlessness we actually have compared to nature which makes me realize how lucky we are to even exist. Even the trek in the depths (ending part) was so emotional. It was bittersweet because it means I am finishing the game but also I am terminating my journey in Rainworld. The visuals and the music really helps to that. From the melancholy of the ending part followed the eerie dreadful feeling the game evokes in me. It felt like I should regret going to such a place but no matter how I try to go back I've made a choice and I cannot change that. I have to endure this chaos. at the very end, peace emerged, it was a relief from all the intense emotions the ending provided from all the music and visuals.

I am deeply amazed by how such a game could evoke such intense emotions. I want to say so much more about all the details of my experience I had with this game and how each made me feel, but it would be too long of a review so that's all. This is an amazing game artistically. The initial challenge seems to turn some players off but even the learning curve is art by itself. The attention to detail in this game is also so phenomenal, I tell you!

185708397.review:
想过给雨世界写评测已经很久了，却一直没写，因为感觉讲清楚我为什么喜欢雨世界、雨世界的魅力等内容，比较费事，想想就很累。而且早就有不少玩家已经分析过了，有不少跟我的想法不同，所以我写的不一定受欢迎，就光说让我不太理解雨世界乐趣的朋友能理解雨世界，都是做不到的，感觉真是没什么意义啊。但本身我写游戏评测，就是纯粹自己想写，所以还是要写的。
首先不得不提我被雨世界背刺之仇（不）。21年在一个朋友的安利下买了雨世界，当时原价68买的，结果没几天打了个史低13，应该是雨世界最便宜的一次，但我已经没退款条件了，唉，背刺。后来也玩不懂就吃灰了，直到23年初dlc更新我才决心要玩完雨世界，翻了些攻略和地图，然后感觉还是很好玩的呀，也不算难的，8个猫都通了。不过竞技场挑战是真折磨，为了打了全成就拼尽全力赤下它。后来跟朋友联机，也很有节目效果，包括一起被固定视角折磨。
实际上我自己在游玩过程中吐槽过很多次雨世界的游戏设计，不说客气话，就说游戏原本屏幕不能跟着主角的移动而滚动这一点，就已经非常离谱了。还有你有没有试过被其他动物的尸体堵住动不了的，想抓住尸体拖走却只能不停地捡起各种杂物，虽然这很真实，但完全有办法优化。还有大部分玩家都会讲的引导问题，雨世界主要是你进去游戏以后不知道该做什么，它仅有的新手说明也让人不知道怎么做这些事。也许这很真实有沉浸感，但是好的游戏引导设计不需要任何文字说明就可以让玩家知道该怎么玩，照样保持沉浸感。而雨世界的玩法也是个大坎。你刚开始玩的时候，不管黄猫白猫，都是一只柔弱蛞蝓猫，而且你还很好吃，新手更不太会杀捕食者，而且雨世界具有的随机性也让各种危险防不胜防，随机性有时候会让你对困境毫无办法，可能这一轮就是注定会死，无法通过操作改变自己的命运，不像我在玩游戏而是被游戏玩。再加上引导问题，也没什么有效的正反馈，被吃几次不关游戏的玩家多半是少数了。还有地图也是个大问题，雨世界地图毫无一般意义上的游戏地图设计感，它的地图只是一个一个一个一个（不）房间简单连接起来的，就很复杂容易迷路，虽然造景是很精致的保持逻辑上的连续性。你要庆幸还好它不像星空有那么好的优化不然得多少次过图黑屏啊。然后那个可视地图的设计也很难受，我不太懂为什么要分两层，搞得很容易混淆，看起来也不方便，它的移动和缩放方式让它看起来比较费劲，我到现在都很讨厌看游戏内的地图，都是常备攻略地图看的。联机做了也只是本地联机的模式，视角固定不能分屏更是经常让我们哀鸿遍野，如果你想听朋友发出动物的声音，就在怪多的时候切视角吧！
见过不止一次有玩家说雨世界不是个游戏，而是一个艺术品。但我个人其实不太认可这种说法。游戏和艺术品本来就不是非此即彼的，游戏还被称为第九艺术呢，它的艺术属性和游戏属性是共存的，说它不像是个游戏还是在宽容它游戏设计方面带给玩家的各种不便。所以雨世界的游戏设计有不少该死的缺陷，但它为什么让很多人着迷，自然是有其魅力所在。
但我首先要说的是，不要再把雨世界的魅力押在所谓“最复杂的生态系统”上了，我看到吹雨世界生态系统就会死（开玩笑我当然不会死）。游戏还是很难做出来生态系统的，毕竟真正的生态系统“指在自然界的一定的空间内，生物与环境构成的统一整体，在这个统一整体中，生物与环境之间相互影响、相互制约，并在一定时期内处于相对稳定的动态平衡状态。”游戏里的生物都是刷出来的，我们只能看到它们之间存在捕食与被捕食的行为，而且雨世界里的植物存在感有点低，很多基本上都是玩家扮演的蛞蝓猫在吃，只有一小部分别的生物会跟植物互动。其实最不可思议的还是拟态草吃秃鹫，暴力代码杀来的。
所以我真正在赞叹的是：第一，雨世界的精致的生物和场景设计；第二，雨世界的世界观设定；第三，雨世界的去主角化特点。
关于雨世界中每个生物精巧又生动的ai，以及各种精致的环境和生物设定。每个生物都在很大程度的随机地移动，悄悄观察它们就能发现，它们会比较自主地移动，有时候会停下来，好像在思考什么似的，那些行为方式跟现实中的野生动物很像。详细来说，就以蛞蝓猫为例吧，猫猫的动作和表情就很多，蛞蝓猫身边有什么东西在动的时候，猫猫就会有个侧脸或者转头抬头的动作，去看那个东西。如果靠到捕食者旁边，猫猫会闭着眼睛做出想把它推开的动作。猫猫行动的动作也特别的丝滑，很自然，还有很多生动的小动作。如果你会后空翻，翻滚等操作更是会发现这种生动感和流畅感。我有一次录下来用自己玩水猫上高墙的一段实况，看着看着就觉得，这像个游戏纪录片似的，好像那个猫不是我在控制，而是自己在行动，这是非常意外而有趣的感受。当然雨世界的精致也体现在丰富的环境设计和富有想象力的生物设定。蛞蝓和猫的结合，会飞的蝉乌贼，倒吊发光还特别能拉丝的光鼠，靠喷气飞行的秃鹫，拉力惊人的拟态草和红树，巨大而可怕的利维坦，还有别忘了那些恐怖的长腿香菇，多半是在有点奇妙的精神状态下构想出来的。各种植物也非常有趣，爆米花、鞭炮草、泡水果，会发光的百合花灯和黏菌等。每个生态域都有其自己独特的特点，也有其特色生物，比如水边有水生的蝾螈等，黑暗的区域就聚集着黑蜥蜴。还有生物的习性，比如金蜥蜴是群居的，拾荒者群居，还具有圈地盘的行为，甚至生物个体之间的性格、地位等区别也被制作了出来，这在猫崽和拾荒者的身上有明显的体现。废土风格的环境景观也独具特色，能感受到自然啃噬文明痕迹后留下的荒凉与生机并存之美，所以雨世界真是个很精致的游戏。
关于雨世界的世界观设定，表面上是蛞蝓猫的一千种死法（划掉）生存冒险寻找回家的路的故事，但在旅途中还藏有更深的关于这个世界的信息。第一次见回响的时候感受到的是一种充满缥缈感的震撼，这个世界里还存在着如此神秘的一面，那时候立刻觉得嘻嘻我一定要玩下去呀。后来，继续漫游在古老文明的废墟之间，穿梭在各种危机四伏的生态域中，攀爬宏伟而又危险的迭代器巨构建筑，见到温柔的以及并不温柔的两位随机的神明。在高耸入云的尖塔上倾听如茫茫夕阳般的回忆，于空中的浮岛建筑中看到雨后初晴的彩虹，在遍布食肉植物的土地上为大型生物的呆板而气愤，最后追寻着万千生灵的灵魂之光深入地底。第一次置身于深渊里如水波般荡漾的金色光芒中时，那样庄严神圣的氛围，却让人无比激动，经历了这么多磨难，总算得到了渺小而伟大的飞升。（诶我本来不是想回家吗怎么断绝尘缘了）到后来自己再进行了一些了解，才逐渐知晓了这世界曾经的文明、信仰和它的终点，万物轮回的困局，迭代器的追求和挣扎，被埋藏在遗迹之下的解脱之法。这宏大、神秘而又冷漠的世界，这停滞不动，却又生机勃勃的世界，想来也是异常迷人的吧。
关于去主角化，这个说法是我在看过别的玩家的分析之后逐渐了解的，确实是雨世界的主要特色之一。蛞蝓猫并不是这个世界的主角，它只是一个小小的生物，它只是自己寻找着回家的路，做不出什么大的改变，渺小而又平平无奇，在偌大的世界一角进行着属于自己的艰苦的生存之旅。所以说雨世界真实啊，柔弱蛞蝓猫独自一个掉到了这个新区域，你自然什么都不知道了，要引导干什么；你是只总是一脸茫然的蛞蝓猫，你当然总是在乱窜迷路了；捕食者的行动也不会是固定的，它们当然比你强，没有武器就毫无办法，猫被吃就会死，这一天重来吧。雨世界的主角只是个小小的生物，它很顽强又很脆弱，它没有高超的战斗技巧，也不能学会强大的技能，它不是战士，也不是注定要拯救或改变世界的主角。这就是蛞蝓猫，你扮演成它，就能真切地体验到一个小生物在危险的广阔世界里生存的艰辛，就能以一个渺小之物的视角仰望宏伟的建筑，穿梭在古代文明的遗迹之间，没有探险和考古的任务，不过是以一个过路的生物的视角来看待一切。它给人一种平静、真实的感觉，我们只是一个平凡的小生物，在神秘的世界里想办法把自己的生活过下去，不需要当英雄，不需要必须通过一道道拦路的关卡，不需要以一己之力干掉一个接一个的强大敌人，可以很自由地选择到底是正面迎敌还是躲起来逃跑，自由地选择各种探险的线路。这就是去主角化的感觉，你不是主角，这个世界里也没有谁是真正意义上的主角。世界的走向与你无关，你不需要去承担什么重任，只要自己生存，以一个渺小生物的视角去探索这个世界，走向自己要去的地方。这能够带来比较独特的，比较自由的游戏体验。
以上所写的一些特点在dlc里面有所改变和削弱。dlc猫并不弱小，个个拥有比本篇猫要强很多的技能，游戏流程具有了更加明确的目标，它们在这个世界做出的改变也比较明显，甚至成为重要的角色。我也看过相关的分析，dlc改变了雨世界本身的风格，注重雨世界本身的去主角化特点的老玩家会因为这一点而比较反对dlc的一些内容因素，认为它破坏了雨世界很重要的特点。包括迭代器的塑造问题，他们的定位更应该像是对平凡的生命并不在意的高位存在，他们的程序和自认为的使命让他们沉迷于研究和计算如何摆脱轮回，作为随机的神明，众多生灵不过是尘土一般的微不足道。但是在dlc里面迭代器的神性被削弱了，他们跟蛞蝓猫之间的联系更加密切，对它们产生了更多的情感，也许这并不符合迭代器的定位，蛞蝓猫也变得过于重要了。不过这些在游戏设定上还是可以被合理化的。迭代器经过漫长的岁月，他们互相之间也存在对彼此的情谊，他们是有感情的，在很多方面跟人类一样，也会感悟和改变，对蛞蝓猫也没有特别亲密，更像是态度发生了些变化。关于dlc猫的技能，怎么一看是挺离谱的，但游戏还是尽量做出了逻辑闭环的设定，虽然这些信息可能不明显。作为信使的猫有点强大的能力归功于迭代器的改造就行了，虽然说实在的会生矛但没有嘴的吸血紫薯面对群魔乱舞的世界到底哪里强大了。水猫的特性可以是进化的产物，也可能是迭代器改造，炸猫和饕餮的能力大概是利用某种微生物，在怪猫通关后的小游戏里面描述了炸猫用一种细菌转化物体的过程，看得出来制作组也有在完善设定了。圣猫是最没有办法解释的，实际上圣猫已经多次轮回，玩家游玩的并不是它获得能力的开始，它的能力如何而来并没有解释，也许归于玄学和未知也并非不是一个办法。
dlc猫毕竟前身是社区的mod，有很多超模之处，跟雨世界本篇的风格并不太相称，但是制作组能把它们融到本篇里面，还扩展了故事，联通了时间线，尽量完善了设定，我觉得挺好的，游戏的内容变得丰富了很多。而且不可否认的是，dlc猫正是因为具有多样的特点和较强大的技能而好玩，dlc更具可玩性的主要原因就在这里。但引导还是一样的不行，没去看过游戏社区的话我并不觉得我能知道每个猫的通关目标是什么。dlc的加入让雨世界变得更好了吗？在我看来，而且我相信大部分玩家会觉得是变好的，游戏确实更好玩了。而如前文所述的一些老玩家会觉得是不好的，因为雨世界本篇的去主角化风格遭到了一定程度的破坏。这种对原教旨主义原则的追求是很有必要的，很多独立游戏优秀的命脉就在于它的独特性，比如它的创新的核心玩法，别出心裁的核心设计，别有特色的风格等，如果破坏和改变了这些因素，游戏是不是就可能会变得泯然众游了呢。对于雨世界来说，它的独特性就在它自己独特的游戏设计和风格上，如果这一点被破坏，那当然是不好的。因此也需要理解对dlc的批评。
总之，关于雨世界，我算是写完了想要表达的东西，不过也有更多想法和感受不是这么轻易就能表达完全的吧。从某种意义上来说，虽然游戏设计的有些地方让人胃痛，但雨世界还是个非常特别的，其核心设计几乎不能被复刻的游戏，它吸引了很多人的喜爱。最重要的是，它让我度过了难忘而又快乐的游戏旅程，所以我喜爱它。

Gotta be one of my favorite games of all time. This game is worth the effort. You will suffer, and that's okay. That suffering will teach. 

Here is my advice. Take your time with this game. Accept that you will die. Though it may seem like you're losing something at first, in reality every death is a learning opportunity. 10/10, I've beaten the game like 9 times at this point. #10 is soon to be complete too.

185602966.review:
I usually detest platformers built around the "respawn until you get it right" format, respawning in the same room repeatedly until you discover the correct sequence of moves, necessitating near flawless execution. Those kinds of platformers are typically adjacent to puzzle games, your moveset being the puzzle pieces, and the environment the layout where the pieces are to fall. It's a subgenre I can appreciate at a distance, you solve the puzzle, but then are presented the secondary challenge of stringing the puzzle pieces together through mechanical skill - it's an interesting way of expanding complexity in a genre often prone to instinctual, intuitive gameplay or rote memorization.

But man I just cannot handle the tedium of retrying until the execution falls in place. I love solving the puzzle itself, executing its movements, not so much.

Rain World does not deposit you in the same room when you die. You go all the way back to a save point, and are then tasked with completely re-assessing your plan. Enemies move around, conditions change, and a near immeasurable amount of variables threaten to unseat those plans. The game knowledge present in Rain World is immense, and the opacity of its mechanics and variables means that every bit of knowledge is gained through experimentation, observation, and oftentimes, pure chance. From movement, to environmental interactions, to enemy behavior, and even the particulars of its randomization.

Enemies are lethal and vicious, but they are entities with behaviors that can be anticipated or even manipulated, not every scenario necessitates brute-force mechanics, and due to Rain World's relatively disempowered movement in regards to your character, you oftentimes can't progress if you insist on that approach.

The emphasis on ecology and enemy behavior means that each attempt feels genuinely different. Which enemies are in the room with me? Which prey animals? What tools are there on the ground? Which path and which pipes take me where? All of these factors change how you attempt to solve any given situation.

Most platformers that require iterative attempts until success are incredibly deterministic. Rain World is not. You are often just as screwed over by your own expectations as you are by exterior concerns. Rain World demands awareness, it demands you respect your enemies, but at the same time, it encourages you to play with fire by using the very enemies as tools for success.

It's brilliant execution, and the lack of typical power-ups forces the player to maintain this adaptibility from beginning to end. When your gameplay becomes effortless, it's because your ability to utilize the knowledge you have increases, and Rain World never fails to surprise you with new tidbits of knowledge, just when you think you've figured things out, a new revelation completely changes your approach.

It's a fuck of a game difficulty-wise, but without that difficulty the game simply would not work. One of the most justified and necessary high difficulty curves I've seen in a game, period.

例如聖徒在無聲構造去找迴響的位置，有個區域有大量鋼鳥，而這邊躲避鋼鳥的方法就是爬竿子，但有非常多個竿子高度是不夠的，兩群鋼鳥互撞打架就極高機率會看到你，那你就死定了。此外這邊地形複雜，鋼鳥很容易會有落單個體，當你以為安全選擇離開時，就很高機率會撞上落單個體而死亡。這一切就已經夠糟了，還可能出現拾荒者來攪局，而這邊地面到處淹水，要快速移動也沒有任何辦法，所以一切都只能靠運氣。

然後更慘的是，這個區域上方有個位置有兩隻狼蛛，我運氣太差卡太久，他們全部都進化變成有遠程能力的烈焰狼蛛，要通過這個區域就只能反覆機械化作業不斷刷次數直到運氣極好的情況下才能通過。

這種純粹靠運氣的設計就跟難度無關了，運氣好的人可能完全不會注意到這個位置很難，但運氣太差到生物進化後，這裡就無解了，這個設計實在是致命性地糟糕。

185578022.review:
I’ve had my eye on this game a while. A fan of the survival genre, and hearing about the rich ecosystem Rainworld has to offer where you’re just another part of the food chain, I finally decided to purchase. 

Okay so first off, this game is punishing. Rainworld doesn’t seek to hold your hand, but that’s one of the things I most enjoy about survival games - your character is dumped in an unforgiving world and you have to figure it out and strive to survive. I’m only early into the game (although my hours spent indicates otherwise - yep I’ve died a lot) and I already love it. Has dying ever been so addictive? Although difficult, after another inevitable death, this game makes me want to put on my big girl pants and try again. Testament to the fascinating world created here. Along the way you meet new and unique creatures - are they are threat? How do they move? More importantly, how do I get past them and live another day. The enemies are extremely dynamic and I’m already witnessing how clever the AI is here. Unlike most games, the environment really is living and breathing whether you’re around to witness it or not. My little slugcat was a pesky little bugger to move around at first, but have started to get more comfortable with their movement over time and there’s gratification in that. I can already see many hours plowed into this game. Writing this review after a much needed breather, but I will be back to live another day as a slug cat! Highly recommend. This game already feels like it’s gonna be one of my all time favs.

185551286.review: perhaps one of my new favorite games of all time. i have many hours outside of steam (on my switch lol) and have nearly completed all campaigns- but even without the downpour dlc which massively expands the game, this is thoroughly worth playing on its own. i'll admit, i was introduced to this game by my sibling specifically because they know i really love metroidvanias. that is what i came into the game expecting, and so my perspective of this game revolved a lot around that. i know it is contentious to label this game as a metroidvania because it is also mainly a survival game with precision platforming and ecosystem simulating elements, but i feel the connection is really there. if you go into this game thinking it is a metroidvania, you will be met with one of the richest, most rewarding, and freshest takes on the genre. design tropes like ability gating progression and backtracking through previous areas are abstracted by the players own need to experiment in order to survive, which makes them feel more like a natural part of that exploration survival cycle rather than an artificial game objective. all of this feeds into the immersion of the player as a small creature trying to get by in a world which is utterly uncaring to them. because of this, the experience of rain world is extremely unique. there is nothing quite like it. the story, though subtle as first, always manages to throw its hardest gut punches. even if you do not vibe with it, i would strongly advise checking it out. a numerical rating cannot do this justice.

ВЫВОД

是一款平台跳跃玩法游戏，你扮演一只会使用各种道具的蛞蝓猫，在野兽丛生的世界中生存，追寻心中的答案。
这款游戏我觉得相较于其他同类游戏，更惬意一点，很多乐趣其实是在你到达一片新区域遇到一个震撼你的生物或结构时带来的惊奇，所以可能和其他同类游戏有所不同。
不太适合执着于通关的普通玩家，因为你要成功通关不仅是需要记住地图，还需要规划路线，学习如何应对一些生物，并且要有足够运气，很多时候你都是无功而返甚至重回解放前。但是如果你想挑战自己那么你可以尝试！
个人认为这款游戏艺术表达足够强烈，但是游戏玩法目的性不强。如果你是一个追求目标的玩家那么雨世界可能不太适合你。我不是硬核玩家，我看着攻略用了二十小时才通关最简单的猫猫......并且之后我经常在一个地方卡关，进也不是退也不是，还很容易迷路，地图功能非常难用，很多时候都是网上找张图然后拿着放大镜找我在哪我要去哪里...

剧情方面真的不必多说，非常宏大的剧情，但是只靠玩游戏我觉得是有点难理解的，我建议还是去看一下解说。主要是引导太少了，刚玩的时候总是不知道自己要干什么，去看的攻略一般都是速通没什么参考价值。但是你了解剧情后就会发现真的很厉害，走到和剧情有关的场景会很震撼！！
画面也非常棒，这是我截图最多的游戏。但就是有几个场景很黑，感觉很伤害眼睛（）
很多人说操作难度很大，但我觉得前期可能有点困难，但熟练了就会好很多，但如果你是追求那种杀手型的话可能就有点困难了，我玩了这么久还没学会单杀蜥蜴（目移）但！是！最重要的是就是，一定要想清楚了再去开开发者模式的作弊，谨慎搜索怎么使用，我就是开了作弊导致再也回不到以前了（哭）
还有就是能买dlc一定要去买，好玩的角色都在dlc里面，剧情方面也会更好理解。
总之是很好的游戏，希望大家玩的开心！

Rain World definitely has to go up there for my favorite game in recent years.

Its brutally difficult as you go up the roster of scugs, but it has such a bitter-sweet, deep and interesting lore when you start delving into things.

It will absolutely kick your butt. Repeatedly, but something about the  thought of getting these poor slugcats to their destinations just keeps me going.

Amazing soundtrack, expansive map to explore, and the ability to tweak up difficulty with various settings and a deep modding library make this a definite pick up.

Also: Get the Meadow Mode mod. Its a great way to decompress after some stressing cycles with just being able to enjoy and explore the map.

185480873.review:
[h3] [u] [b] **Spoiler-Free Review**[/b] [/u] [/h3]
[b] TL;DR: [/b] Rain World is amazing. Anyone who may be interested should give it a try. Just... do yourself a favour, and don't look at the wiki. Or online guides, or anything of the sort. Ever. At the very minimum, until you beat the game once. [u]Rain World is, by far, my favourite game in the genre, and certainly in my top 3 games of all time.[/u]

[b]This game will break you down to nothing. Be ready for that.[/b] The best moments of Rain World arise from [i][b]overcoming[/b][/i] challenges, and there is no shortcut for that. At times, you may have to backtrack, head a different way, and improve your skills: there's no rush.

"What do I do? Where do I go? Is there an ending? Where is it?" [u]Trust me, you don't want it to be spoiled.[/u] Everything you need to know to beat the game can be found throughout the course of the storyline. Why not buy it and see for yourself?

[h3] [u] [b] The (Much Longer) Rant [/b] (also spoiler-free, as is the rest of the review) [/u] [/h3]
If I could say just one thing, it would be to avoid the wiki (and spoilers in general) like the plague, even when you get stuck (perhaps with the exception to be made of movement mechanics, many of which are never even mentioned without the "remix" option enabled in the settings (which is free, but rarely mentioned)). The mysteries to be found deserve to be found organically, and the overall experience is much more impactful when experienced this way.

[b] The Worldbuilding [/b]
Each and every atmosphere is stunning, packed from top to bottom with places to go and sights to see. The world so cohesively blends together that it really inspires you to push further into the post-apocalyptic landscapes, especially with the DLC (which I would highly recommend) that adds many more regions and ways to play. The replayability for this game is so much higher than you might expect, with potentially hundreds of hours of gameplay (with the DLC, at least 60 without) between the different characters.

The way that the world's lore unfolds as you progress inspires the completionists to find every last detail, many of which can be found through optional (albeit difficult) challenges: for the rest of us, these challenges are strictly optional, allowing one to pick and choose what challenges they do and do not try (if any at all). For the kind of player that is willing to persevere through failure (which [i]will[/i] happen, unrelentingly), this is the highest recommendation I can give. Rain World easily makes my top 3 all-time favourite games, and is by far my favourite in the genre.

[b] Mind the Difficulty [/b]
[u]However.[/u] For anyone that might be considering this game, be warned that the skill floor is much higher than it might seem at first glance. While the controls seem simple at first, they quickly grow in complexity as the game grows more difficult, with a growing time pressure from ever-more-powerful enemies around every corner. Several people I've known have tried getting into it, before being turned away by this unrelenting spike in difficulty. However, one must understand that [u]it is very possible to improve,[/u] overcoming adversity as you hone your skills. On the other side of the coin, the skill ceiling can take [i]hundreds of hours[/i] to reach: those seeking a brutal and unrelenting challenge will find no shortage of them, especially with the bonus DLC content and post-game/New Game+ options (so to speak, as to not give spoilers).

When you start the game (still no spoilers), you get to choose between a yellow cat and a white cat. [b]Please, for the love of god, do not start as the white cat if you don't know what you're doing.[/b] The difficulty spike is so much higher, which will almost certainly drive the majority of you away. The content of the game is IDENTICAL no matter which of the two you pick, aside from the frequency of threats you face and a small handful of tiny lore tidbits. (Even then, each character has exclusive lore.) At least try to escape the starting region: if you can do so without much difficulty, then is when you should move up to white. It won't take you long to make up progress.

Believe me, I'm not trying to turn anyone away: the world is such a stunning place that it's worth anyone giving it a shot, but one must go into it with the mindset that some areas (if not all of them) will be too hard at first, especially if you set yourself up for failure with little practice and the harder character. The nature of an (almost completely) unrestricted open world packed with challenges is that [b]a new(er) player [u][i]will[/i][/u] stumble into incredibly difficult region(s) at least once[/b] in their first playthrough. The solution? Be willing to find a different path forward, even when it feels you have gone too far to turn back. 

[b] Perseverance is Key [/b]
Of course, give any region you find a solid shot first: you just never know. However, it's likely there may be an even harder area behind it. There is [u]no long-term time pressure[/u] (in your first playthrough at least), so you can try and fail (and perhaps eventually succeed) for as long as you wish. However, any given day will always* have a looming time pressure, acting as a hard cap under which one must attempt to make progress: this acts as just another step in your way, which can be overcome in time with persistence. As the developers have said before, any region is possible without external help: while there are, at times, alternate ways / creative strategies to ease progression, it will often be the best path forward to find another way, should you experience a spike in difficulty that you can't yet overcome.

Excluding the starting region and certain end-game areas, there is no region must be completed within at least the first 12-15 hours of gameplay. Note that this time could be much less, or much more: it really depends on one's skill level, and how interested they are in exploring vs. completing the game. By the time that one may be forced to endure a particularly difficult challenge, I am confident that the skills necessary to progress (no matter how long it may take) are within one's reach: it only takes perseverance to reach it.

[b] Just Try It Already (I mean, if you want) [/b]
In the time you spent reading this (and I spent writing this), we both could have been grinding out the game. What are we doing? If you were considering Rain World, I would highly recommend trying it out: worst case, you have two hours to refund it. Just remember that the true fun of the game is [u]overcoming challenge[/u], rather than simply completing each region. Two hours really isn't enough to understand what this game has to offer, because when you finally overcome that last obstacle after ten, twenty, thirty or even more, completing Rain World is a feeling like no other.

185352997.review:
Шедевр какой ещё надо поискать. Игра брутально сложная и местами абсолютно нечестная. Она на тебя плюет, но именно поэтому настолько в неё погружаешься. Ты ощущаешь себя как мышь в большом городе которую в любую секунду могут съесть и раздавать. Смерть здесь - ключевая часть геймплея. Игра задуманна с тем что вы будете много умирать. К счастью, сильно за это не накзавают. Максимум придется несколько игровых дней бегать набирать еду чтобы в другую зону перейти. А для тех кому нужно есть меню Remix где можно сделать игру более удобной, например сделать видимым счётчик дыхания когда ты под водой. 

Главная магия этой игры в экосистеме. Она настолько продуманна и детальна что невозможно не затеряться в ней. Тебя схватил хищник? Вот приполз другой и напал на первого за твой труп, а ты то ещё жив, и во время их драки сваливаешь пока не заметили. Это лишь один маленький пример того какие тут уникальные взаимодействия существ.

Стиль тоже супер. Смесь милого pixelart и темных, заброшенных локаций создают превосходный контраст, делая визуал хорошо запоминающимся

Основной игре 10/10

Сейчас прохожу сложный режим и с ним все ощущается немного иначе. Не буду давать оценку, так как я буквально на первых этапах, но уже вдвойне ощущается несправедливость игры, в особенности из-за того что она требует дабы этот режим пройти. Советую загуглить что нужно для него, иначе в самом конце прохождения поймёте что всё надо начинать с нуля. 

В общем, базовый режим рекомендую любителям трудных игр, а сложный тем кто реально хочет испытать себя и своё терпение

为什么dlc能收获更多的关注，跟迭代器形象的变化是分不开的。从不可理解却展现仁慈，神一般的造物逐渐转向更具人性的个体，肯定会给予玩家更多交流价值与情感认同，这是从文本上努力提供大众玩家更需要的游戏价值。如果作为一个路人玩家刚入坑便立刻购入dlc，我相信全流程通关比率肯定比原版更多。而弱化迭代器“神”的属性是否对雨世界剧情造成了伤害？我认为不一定是一种伤害，更像是剥开神性的掩饰，展现废土世界下负有沉重使命的有机机械生命更显人性的心理的可能。雨世界的生物相当一部分都与机械相结合，反之机械的迭代器呢？在无数的雨循环中祂们是否找到了自我生命实现的新形式？也许在监视者传输了这个世界无数的生命努力为生存而奔波的画面后，神的内芯也写下了人性之花的代码。猫猫们跨越了更久远的时间，就像参与了迭代器的生命过程，留下了自己独一无二的一段故事，他们不只是为了生存或为了找到自己在生态圈的位置而奔走在高墙，海岸线与地下，他们的生命与迭代器交织，就像水滴融入河流，个体写入历史。dlc不只是因为猫猫变异而吸引人，更在于猫猫的进化陪伴着迭代器人性意识走向圆融。

The concept is cool, the world is beautiful, the game is designed to be completely against the player.
And I don't mean in the way that the game is designed to challenge you in well thought out scenarios or puzzles or that you have to learn movesets or something like in Elden Ring or that you have interesting combinations of factors put in place by the devs... You just get socked by all sorts of RNG in environments that really seem counter to the actual creatures in it half of the time, because they are.
This game is anti it's player. It's so difficult you will try to push forward for the story and then you'll realize the game doesn't even tell you which way IS forward.
In a game where deaths are very punishing and you need not inconsiderable time to more or less HAPPEN upon food to up your Karma to go through a gate in the unknown INTO the unknown, you get no tutorial, no info on mechanics and a fucking TIME LIMIT that can be RANDOMIZED and ALSO kills you and sets you back.

I wanted to like this game so bad and now I'm at a point where, even if I did make it further, it'd bring me no joy, just resentment.

185311936.review: Rain World es sin lugar a duda un juego único, durante las primeras horas de juego puede ser frustrante y tedioso debido a la combinación de su alta dificultad con el factor suerte presente durante toda la aventura, sin embargo si decides oponerte a las adversidades y avanzar la recompensa será gigante. El mundo de Rain World está vivo (literalmente) cada criatura existe independientemente de ti e inclusive se relaciona con su entorno sin que estés presente por lo que no será raro hallar peleas de las cuales no formas parte, cada ser actúa con el único objetivo de sobrevivir lo que lleva a cada criatura a actuar en base a su conveniencia, pero nosotros somos capaces de intervenir haciendo amigos y enemigos en el proceso, ayudar y atacar culminaran en como viviremos nuestro camino. Muchas veces (quizás demasiadas) las muertes se pueden sentir injustas es normal sentir que no perdimos por nuestra incompetencia, sino por el factor RNG, genuinamente el juego es desesperante, pero a su vez adictivo el hecho de que las criaturas no posean puntos de aparición predeterminados ni formas de actuar exactas hace que el juego sea impredecible, lo que a su vez lo hace sentir vivo. A lo largo de mi vida como jugador nunca experimenté algo parecido, no lo considero el mejor juego jamás creado, pero sin ningún lugar a dudas estamos ante una obra maestra.

185308577.review:
This is the best game I've ever played.

You either put the game down after a couple of hours, assuming its a boring, repetitive eat-n-sleep simulator, or you play a little longer and get hooked. Once you're hooked it only gets better, and you can never get enough. You complete every campaign multiple times, finding something new and appreciating the intricate details, outstanding world-driven storytelling, beautiful artstyle, unique creatures, the list goes on forever!

Please try Rainworld. And if this or one of the other amazing reviews persuade you to give it a shot, dont go in expecting a big, overstimulating AAA title. Rainworld is its own thing. You will get frustrated and you will die, you're supposed to. The more you play the more you understand, it just takes a little patience to make the snowball big enough for it to roll down the hill :)

This game made me and everybody I know cry multiple times, and trust me, it'll make you cry too. I'll never forget Rainworld, its an irreplacable gem.

185298701.review:
Amazing game. Loved exploring this decaying and solemn that's contrasted with these beautiful views that are full of life, feeling like its own little ecosystem you just exist in. While the gameplay loop of being on a daily timer could a bit frustrating and stressful, it definitely helps put you in the shoes of what its like to struggle to survive on the middle of the food chain. And on top of all of it, seeking out to uncover the true lore of the world will leave you with an interesting and introspective tale that will recontextualize your view of your journey what the locations you explore truly are.


The Downpour DLC is more of an expansion on the lore of the world with some fun new mechanics to play around with. The locations will be fairly repetitive and a few altered/brand new, and you'll probably be fairly good at the game once you move on to it taking away from that first awe of exploration and struggle to survive the main game emphasized, which I could definitely see some players leaving with a lack of substance. If you are hooked by the story being told like me though, and wanted to dive further in depth while acting as a more impactful force in it than the base game, you will love it.

Would definitely recommend experiencing the base game, and playing Downpour if the main game's story enamored you as well.

185254085.review:
《雨世界》，一款由赛博生态模拟器转变而来的探索游戏，我被概念吸引慕名而来。当我终于让这个薄弱的小家伙脱离循环时，我认为我想好怎么评价了（纯主观，参考意义少）
先说优点，游戏的像素美术与音乐足以拉动你的心情，生物的生态也足够生动（甚至有进化），你可以慢慢观察到生物习性——并以此让游戏更舒服。剧情方面，本体和dlc在一些设定上有不同，不过这不妨碍你感受这个停滞世界的绝望和希望（真正妨碍你的在下文中再讲）。
然后是缺点，他注定比我的称赞多。
【h2]不明显、甚至可以骂漏讲的指引：[/h2]
游戏的很多操作需要时间和“尤里卡”，各种动作技巧和物品交互需要你有心探索实验——然后你必须耐下性子，思考按了什么键？你不是全心全意的游戏党不一定会这样做。哪怕是这一类人，我打赌大部分也要花不少时间或直接看攻略。我花了较多时间才搞明白一些基础操作······还有关于某区域的不满，不过我打算放到下一个点讲。
[h2]你狠渺小？[/h2]
是的，你在这个游戏中扮演最弱小的生物，你缺少对全局的掌控能力，不熟悉游戏时这会是一个难受的下马威（熟悉后可以稍微缓解）。好在有其他东西转移你的注意力，加上必要的耐心，让你坚持下去。
然后，你到了【spoiler]农场阵列[/spoiler],这里加重了无力感，生物设计并没有那么难受。但是糟糕的ai和代码，还有“写实”让你可能在那耽搁太久，从而引起不爽。（其实不止一条路可以去目的地，但是对新人来讲，他们大概率会跟着剧情指引到这。）
[h2]麻烦的听故事：（[/h2]
我对碎片叙事无所谓，然而雨世界的文本收集太麻烦了······每个区都有特定道具，然后你要拿去特定区域给npc才可以看文本。问题是游戏的快捷移动设计很拧巴，制作组想让移动方式设计符合设定，又想让玩家舒服点。所以这群弱智把快捷移动和成就挂钩，在局内完成成就条件才能得一次快捷移动？大部分成就可不好拿，需要你熟悉游戏有意识主动拿才行，而且提示也比较糟糕······新手不一定明白怎么拿到。
而且又是“写实”的锅，你不能一次性或几趟就全拿去给npc——因为你只有手和一个胃袋······（建议用开发者工具直接读，不然太麻烦）
[h1]总结下来，没时间，没挑战心、没耐心不要碰[/h1]

185248125.review:
this is not a game. this is a small life. what VideoCult has given you is truly a world. a simulated ecosystem. people complain that this game has bad RNG with the 'enemy' spawns. and I saw someone critique the gates in the world as if they were game mechanics.

this is not a game.
it's made of game mechanics, a food system, a sleep system, a kind of day/night cycle, combat, movement tech, and so on.
but in a game the details of each of those systems are taught, and you're directly rewarded for your mastery of its systems. but RainWorld is entirely indifferent. you live, you die, and you live again. yes you can kill lizards and vultures and what not. but you don't get points from it. the game just continues, it barely even flinches. frankly you seldom know when you've succeeded in killing something until the end of the cycle. 

the point is that this is a world
not a story. you're not uniquely powerful. you are small, and your spot on the food chain is barely higher lantern mice. your place in this world is small, and the world itself is utterly massive. there is a story in this game. but it's mostly told through the environment, which is probably why it has a souls-like tag, if you pay attention and are patient. you can begin to make your way through the survivor's campaign. alternatively you could kill the weird yellow hologram plant guide and just be a little slugcat. there's no wrong way to exist here. 

what makes Rainworld interesting
there are a few layers of really interesting things that this game is doing, most importantly is the entirely different approach to NPCs. when I said this is really a simulated ecosystem, I meant it. every creature has predators and prey. every creature has to go out when its safe, find food, and find shelter, all before the torrent, all while trying to stay alive. every being in this ecosystem is bound to the same rules as you, every bit as vulnerable as you. moving on, we also have to talk about the absolutely juicy lore and history this game has. bloodborne levels of information squirreled away in the branching paths. all waiting to be uncovered. a deep history of a vanished civilization. with deep spiritual themes.
and if you so choose, you can simply ignore all of that. just bask in the beauty of the art, the world, the incredible lighting and breathtaking setting.

if you're looking for a game. kick rocks. this is for people who want to live in a massive world from the perspective of something as small and cute as a slugcat.

185191868.review:
[h3] 注意：隐藏文本包含对游戏特性/剧情等的介绍或提及，非常希望自己探索的玩家请谨慎点开。 [/h3]
本来打算全成就了再写评测，但是出于种种原因[spoiler] 打挑战70打破防了 [/spoiler]决定提前写。
[h3] 虽然是好评，但是我必须要先写劝退的点： [/h3]
首先是这游戏引导真的很差。刚开始玩的时候我完全不知道我要干什么，到处乱走，结果非常自然而然地迷路然后卡在某个地方出不去了。我是看完剧情解析、清楚知道每只猫要做什么之后对照着地图慢慢跑的。说真的，最好看了攻略再玩这个游戏，至少要对目的地有清楚的认知。
第二，游戏难度对新手来说略高，而且有些操作教程要看运气才能刷出来——刷出来的时候玩家往往已经在B站等地方上看完攻略了。比如说，同时按斜下和跳可以滑行；急转时跳跃可以后空翻；后空翻时可以下插矛等等。也就是说，如果入坑了，推荐去看看操作教程视频。
第三点和第二点本质上是一样的，游戏里不会给你每种生物的特性说明，所以推荐去看看生物介绍视频。[spoiler] 比如说，可以给拾荒者送礼物和他们成为朋友；可以给蜥蜴送肉与他们成为朋友；面条蝇是中立生物，但是如果你抓了小面条蝇之类的则会发动攻击；收费站的拾荒者用手臂画圈是允许通过的标志等。 [/spoiler]
第四，没有正反馈。你不会学到新的技能，攻击力不会提升，杀死其他生物后除了减少了一点威胁之外基本没有好处，但同时死亡惩罚带来的负反馈是非常直观的，很考验心态。
第五，剧情比较破碎，即使游戏通关了也不见得理解到底讲了个什么故事，而且很多细节分散在地图的各个地方[spoiler] 指彩色珍珠，要全收集真有点困难 [/spoiler]。强烈推荐去看剧情解说[spoiler] 和收集品文本 [/spoiler]。
[h3] 如果以上可以接受，那么以下是我推荐的原因。 [/h3]
首先，即使不考虑DLC，雨世界的世界观也相当宏大，有很多值得讨论、深挖的地方。剧情也相当庞大，而且加入DLC之后更丰富。地图里也可以看到很多细节，[spoiler] 比如不同时间线的猫有不同的地图，但你仍然能看出很多对应的地方，体现出时间的变更。 [/spoiler]
第二，美术风格很独特，而且很美。有很多很棒的生物和场景等待探索。不着急的话，不妨到处转转，看看各地的美景。[spoiler] 像我第一次见到高墙和高墙的夜晚时就非常震撼。 [/spoiler]
以上是我尽量针对游戏本体做出的评价，在加入DLC后：
第三，玩法上限很高。[spoiler] 探险、挑战等的加入使得这个游戏的玩法更加丰富，更不用说各种mod了。 [/spoiler]
第四，蛞蝓猫很可爱。
可能这篇文章列了很多缺点，优点却很少。我个人认为雨世界的游戏性确实不足，更多的是艺术性。还是希望写了这么多不要吓到想入坑的新人，有时候只有亲自上手玩一玩才知道自己到底喜不喜欢：适合自己的游戏才是好游戏。
wawa！

185131184.review:
ゲームの説明がなさすぎる。オブジェクトの効果や他の生物のことなど何もわからないまま放り出されて、プレイしても理解するまでに時間がかかり、かといって有力な攻略情報があるわけでもない。ゲーム内で説明されていないことが多く、ヒントらしきものはあるが結局なにを伝えたいヒントかもわからない。
理不尽さを楽しむゲームなのは理解できるが、俗にいう死にゲーの類の中でも「世界に理解をするころには詰んでいる」類。死んで覚えて再チャレンジするのではなく、死んでも自分の糧にならないことの方が多い。
グラフィックとBGMはとてもよく、世界観に浸るに適しているが死にゲーなのに「死にすぎると詰む」上にマップも見にくく、シェルターの場所もなにもかも覚えるまでに時間がかかる。重要そうなところに行ってもこのゲームは死にすぎると詰むのでそこから先に進めず、かといって最初からやるには時間がかかりすぎている。
つまるところ理不尽さが世界観というよりもゲームシステムによるものが大きく、フロムだとかの死にゲーにある「死んでも次に繋がりそうななにか」は得られない。自分の進捗が進んでいるように感じられず、進んだところで詰むこともある。
また敵のAIも謎なことが多く、敵性生物をやり過ごそうにもその場でぐるぐる暴れていたり全く動かなかったりで進めようがなかったりととにかく「ゲームシステム」が気持ちよくない。自分の進捗もわからないから越えられた時の気持ちよさはない。おそらくゲームクリアしなければ得られないのだろうから、つまらないなと思ってしまう。そんなゲームです。

長く話してしまったが
・ゲーム内で説明される事柄がほぼない。ストーリーも操作も説明はほぼない。
・ゲームシステムによる理不尽のため、理不尽な世界を遊ぶではなく理不尽なゲームをやらされる。
・理不尽なのは敵のランダム性、敵のAI、時間経過による強制ゲームオーバー、マップのみにくさ（その上広い）
・進捗が得られにくいため死んでもやる気がわきにくいゲーム設計
・本当にゲームの説明が無さすぎる。プレイした人のブログなどで判明する仕様が多すぎる。
・死にゲーなのに死にすぎると詰む。最初からやるとしてもやり直す前から得られるものはほとんどない。

これらがプレイしての感想です。正直、グラフィックとBGMが良いというのと勧められて購入したがクリアしたら二度と遊ばないだろうなと思います。これを人に勧めるなんてとても出来ない。プレイして楽しかったのは最初だけで、あとはもう楽しくないまま折角買ったからクリアくらいはしようという意地でやった程度です。本当にお勧めしない。
理不尽な死にゲーというより、不親切設計なゲームという感じ。死にゲーとは達成感を得るための難易度だと思うのですが、これにはない。二度とやるか、と思う時点で死にゲーとしてアウトだと思う。

185113595.review:
[h1]스스로 살아숨쉬는 게임[/h1]
Rain World는 슬러그캣이 되어 자연속에서 살아남는 게임이다. 다양한 세계를 탐험하며 위협적인 몬스터와 전투하고, 허기를 채워가며 진실을 향해 나아가는 게임이다.

[h2]장점[/h2][list]
[*][b]독특하고 개성적인 세계관 및 아트[/b]
[*][b]스스로 돌아가는 자연 생태계의 구현[/b]
[*][b]정말 다양한 파고들 요소[/b]
[/list]


[h2]단점[/h2][list]
[*][b]불친절한 게임 전개[/b]
[*][b]기묘한 조작감[/b]
[*][b]극단적인 난이도[/b]
[/list]


[h1]후기[/h1]
인류가 불을 발견한 이후, 아니 어쩌면 그 이전부터 우리는 태어날 때부터 어떤 문명의 축복속에서 보호받게 된다. 부모라는 존재부터 출발하여 무수한 인간 무리로부터 보호받고, 그런 보호 아래에서 성장하여 또다른 축복을 보호하는 사명을 받는다. 하지만 야생은 다르다. 자신을 낳아준 어미를 제외하면 완전히 새로운 자연에 던져저 홀로 생존해나가야 한다. 동물은 각기 다른 방식이지만 공통적으로 생존을 위해 진화했고, 이 게임에서 슬러그캣이 받아낸 유전자의 축복은 "손"이다.

손은 인류를 먹이사슬 최상위에 올려준 만큼 참 유용하게 쓰인다. 슬러그캣은 무기를 줍고, 던지며, 먹이를 잡을 수도 있다. 한쪽 손에 무언가가 들려있으면 다른 손으로 집으면 된다. 손의 힘을 빌려 이동을 빠르게 하거나 중력을 거스를 수도 있다. 이를테면 통로를 올라간다든지, 아니면 도약을 한다든지. 

하지만 자연은 잔혹하리만큼 공평하다. 그 무엇하나 가르쳐주는 것도 없고, 모든걸 스스로 배워나가야 한다. 앞으로 이 게임을 하면서 정말 많은 방식으로 죽음을 맞이하게 될 것이다. 포식자에게 잡아먹히기도 하고, 벌레가 자기방어를 위해 공격해올 것이며, 인류의 잔재에 휘말리기도 하고, 아니면 단순히 높은 곳에서 떨어질지도 모른다. 아니면 매번 내리는 폭우를 피하지 못했다든지.

그럼에도 당신은 나아갈 것이다. 무수히 많은 시행착오를 겪고, 스스로 돌아가는 자연을 공부하기 시작할 것이다. 그리고 언젠가 당 신은 발견할 것이다. 자연을 적응하는 것에서 그치지 않고 자연 스스로를 이용해나가는 모습을. 하드코어 게임을 좋아하고, 탐험을 좋아하며, 방대한 세계관을 좋아한다면, 어서와라. 하나의 세계가 당신을 기다리고 있다.

p.s. 멀티 상정하고도 30시간 걸렸는데 싱글로는 도대체 어떻게 깸?

185057015.review:
Давно знал про существовании этой игры, даже помню, что с лучшим другом херачились в арене, но я ни разу не касался сюжетки. Относительно недавно увидел игру по скидке и решил опробовать еë: я и подозревать не мог, что именно эта игра станет моей любимой, которую, однако, практически никто из друзей не может переварить. 

Эту игру многие не любят из-за того, что она так таковы не объясняет, что делать; из-за того, что ты умираешь крайне часто как от существ, так и от запутанной структуры регионов; из-за того, что чтобы прогрессировать по регионам, надо определенное количество циклов подряд не умирать в зависимости от того, в какие регионы тебе хочется пойти (где-то надо 2 раза, где-то 4 и так далее), что кажется для начинающих игроков слишком жестоким наказанием за смерти (эту опцию можно отключить к слову); из-за того, что отпадает желание исследовать всë вокруг, ведь можно не успеть спрятаться в убежище перед затопления дождëм, что приведëт к потере прогресса и к фрустрации. 

Лично для меня все эти пункты немного бесили во время первого прохождения, но я дал игре шанс и продолжил в неë погружаться, о чëм ни капли не пожалел: игру в первый раз можно пройти без гайдов, но нужно понимать, что тебе придëтся заходить в каждый регион, который ты видешь, ибо тебе игра не собирается что-то объяснять, но во всяком она хотя бы будет давать некоторые подсказки, а как только доберешься до единственного существа, который умеет что-то говорить понятное, то поймëшь, чего тебе нужно в конце игры добиться; в игре существует огромная экосистема, заполненная большим спектром существ, каждый из которых работает по-разному, что заставляет игрока каждый цикл быть в напряжении, ведь он никогда не знает, что через секунду может произойти, за счëт чего достигается хорошая реиграбельность, ну а строение регионов нужно запоминать, чтобы не попасть в ловушку - тупик, где тебя ящеры какие-нибудь съедят, чтобы не разбиться, чтобы не утонуть из-за незнания того, где есть места для восстановления дыхания и так далее, только вот иногда, когда есть паркур секция, игра может визуально обманывать, ведь ты видишь перед собой платформу, прыгаешь на неë, но на карте еë нет, что приводит к смерти от падения - эта проблема очень сильно всë ещë бесит, поэтому нужно в таких секциях проверять внимательно карту, которая у людей тоже вызывает недоумение из-за того, что она очень странная. Ну а по поводу врат кармы: эта механика бесит людей, но я считаю, что она нужна как раз для того, чтобы ты учился выживать, а не раз за разом умирал, не запоминая свои ошибки, я чисто из принципа не хочу эту опцию убирать. Я уже так давно привык оперативно кушать еду и прятаться в убежище до затопления, что аж практичкески забыл об этой механике. 

Если что каждая из этих вещей, кроме визуального обмана и немного запутанной карты, как раз то, что мне нужно, а именно - напряжëнная выживалка с обширной экосистемой, в которой надо постоянно бегать, защищаться, исследовать целую кучу интересных регионов, которая к тому же не ведëт за ручку и пытается тебя запутать как можно сильнее. Как ни странно, хорроры вообще не пугают или пугают, но чуть-чуть, но на протяжении всего игрового опыта в этой игре (дважды на 100% закрыл, один раз на старом аккаунте, другой на новом, к тому же там я ещë собрал все арены, все записи и жемчуги, все предметы для песочницы и прошëл секретного персоража, короче всë сделал) я срал под себя больше, чем где-либо ещë, ведь даже, если я хорошо знаю, как ведут себя существа, как построен регион, всë равно попадаю в резкие опасные стычки, исход которых никогда не известен. 

Меня графика в играх особо не волнует, ибо мне может не понравиться игра, которая по графике такая вся 4к hd качественная, но при этом может понравиться какая-то инди, которая внешне может казаться не очень, то есть в играх меня волнует в первую очередь сам геймплей, но не графика (если игра плохая в плане геймплея и в плане графики, то на графику могу внимание обратить, но она не главный показатель для оценки), однако если гейплей хороший, то и хорошая графика тоже улучает моë отношение к игре. В этой игре графика суперская: если в неë и не играть, то во всяком случае можно любоваться ею, особенно еë задниками. Я не могу себе представить, как долго разработчики такую красоту делали - они просто молодцы, хорошо постарались. 

Звуки отлично справляются с погружением в экосистему, выполняя информационную функцию: именно благодаря им веришь в живость мира, понимаешь, какая опасность тебя ждëт. Музыка делиться на две категории: та, которая срабатывает в определëнных местах для создания нужного настроения, и та, в которой добавляются новые элементы в зависимости от уровня угрозы, с помощью чего можно при изменениях сразу быть готовым к более тяжëлой ситуации. Обе категории очень качественно сделаны, создают вокруг себя отличную атмосферу почти полной пустоты мира. 

Физика слизнекотов очень странная и непонятная, иногда работающая через жопу (например ложишься на землю, зажимаешь кнопку прыжка, вместо мощного прыжка слизнекот может сделать мега всратый прыжок, из-за которого случиться неприятная смерть), но несмотря на это, можно еë применять для облегчения выживания: 1) вперëд + прыжок и назад = сальто назад; сальто назад + бросок копья вниз/вверх = втыкание копья в пол или потолок, что может понадобиться для того, чтобы попадать в труднодоступные места или убивать всякую противную живность с кайфом. 
2) вниз во время бега + прыжок = скольжение; скольжение + прыжок = отскок, служащим полезным ускорителем твоего передвижения
3) подбор двух камней + бросок = небольшое ускорение; прыжок + небольшое ускорение = более мощный прыжок, полезный для опасных платформинг секций. Есть ещë целая куча полезных комбинаций, но либо я о них не знаю, или же не упомянул. 

Ценник игры конечно весьма дорогой, тем более, если ещë покупать длс, что может ещë больше игроков отпугнуть, всë же игра определëнно того стоит. Не знаю игры, где наиболее сильно чувствуешь опасность окружающей среды и где реально приходиться из кожи вон лезть, чтобы выживать в ужасных условиях. Концовка игры для меня была максимально неожиданной, от которой я в первый раз просто в шоке был, даже сейчас после каждого нового прохождения сижу в шоке как в первый раз: это нужно прочувствовать самому...

185011391.review:
This game is great! When you get the hang of things, it really shines, but be prepared to put of lot of effort and deaths behind you to get there.

There's a lot of janky things in this game - for me it was the enemy placements. More than a few times an enemy was camping just outside a room transition, resulting in a death. The hard part about those thing is understanding that it's simply the state of the world, which is very unfair and you are indeed very far down in the food chain, and it's something you will need to get used to. Thankfully, the game is fairly forgiving with saves/shelters so it doesn't take too long to get back to where you were.

Almost nothing is explained - no bestiary to learn about enemies and no explanation of advanced mechanics, you have to throw yourself out there and find out. The story is fairly deep if you manage to find all bits and pieces of it, otherwise it does an okay job of reminding you what your main goal is.

However! The visuals are awesome, especially if you like pixel/low res graphics, with lots of environments portraying a very grim and abandoned world. Animations are fluid and the music creates and very immersive atmosphere.

This game is one of the greats.

Please play it!

184999508.review:
Rain World is the most notable title that manages to simulate an impressively dynamic ecosystem, one where you are near the bottom. Full of creatures and subspecies with unique abilities, and more interestingly, unique behaviors and temperances, intuition is your best tool for adapting to the inhabitants and perils of this harsh, decrepit world, where "days" are delineated only by the irregular intervals between deadly, torrential downpours that either pulverize or drown anything caught outside of shelters constructed by a long-dead civilization.

Behind the guise of a brutally unforgiving sandbox that gives the player barely any direction is a massive world with a plenitude of charm and mystery, hidden secrets and respites, gorgeous and gritty scenery, and immense potential for mastery with its surprising technical depth--an explorer and movement tech enthusiast's wet dream, though this may not be for those who demand clear progression, or do not enjoy exploring for its own, intrinsic sake.


I highly recommend trying Rain Meadow (new synchronous multiplayer mod) on the steam workshop if a break from the somber atmosphere is needed, or company is wanted!

184888074.review:
The one true survival game.

Strange, gross, mean-spirited, and unrelenting in its execution. It feels like you're watching real biology persist on your screen, and I'm not sure any game has given me such a feeling before. 

This title doesn't follow proper game-fundamentals. It doesn't tell you what you're supposed to be doing, it simply drops you into a dynamic digital ant farm and asks you to learn. This means it can be very frustrating at times, very unfair - you are the bottom of a food chain that stretches up very high above your own. In its frictional design exists a survival game that, by its nature, trumps all those lame resource-management titles that so confidently claim the term 'survival' for their own. 

 - This is a true survival game. A game where its challenges aren't surmounted by simple pattern recognition, or by abusing the systems inherent to the game; where it's safer to hide than to fight, where the need for food shifts your entire plan, and each moment is coupled with an anxiety that you could be killed by a half-dozen different elements out of the blue. 

And yes, that is a lot, but that's nature. A worse game would only apply these rules to the player, but in Rain World, every beast abides by that nature, and you, being a big-brained human-person, can use that to your advantage - that's why it feels so rewarding when you do succeed under such insurmountable circumstances, and why I believe this to be one of the few true-to-form survival games out there. You never feel on top of the situation, but you can always learn, improve, adapt and think.

184870701.review:
Impecável, simplesmente um jogo maravilhoso, com uma trila sonora e ambientações inéditas, a IA deste jogo é muito bem feito e inteligente.
O jogo se baseia em um ecossistema com uma cadeia alimentar bem ativa e presente no game, você é praticamente a base dela, é um jogo parcialmente injusto, até poque, por mais que seja um """jogo de sobrevivência""", ele é diferente dos outros jogos deste tipo, já que nos outros você aos poucos vai ficando mais forte e vai dominando a natureza, as vezes chegando ao ponto até de automatizar ela. Mas neste jogo, você começa na base da cadeia alimentar e termina na base da cadeia alimentar, a unica coisa que você ganha aos poucos aqui é conhecimento sobre este mundo.
Inclusive a avaliação dele no Metacritic está totalmente errada, até porque se você ver as reviews dos criticos, eles reclamam bastante da dificuldade do jogo.
Mas a ideia que o jogo quer passar é essa, que você (slugcat) é extremamente vulnerável as criaturas deste mundo, e outra coisa que reclamam bastante de Rain World é de sua animação procedural, que na minha opinião é incrivel, até porque para mim da um toque mais natural ao jogo.


Mas enfim... Eu amo muito esse jogo, por mais que eu seja horrível em jogos assim (dificuldade alta), eu ainda sim adoro bastante esse jogo, e por mais que eu n tenha muitas horas do jogo na steam, o tanto que eu joguei isso no pirata até arranjar o dinheiro para comprar ele foi putaria. Mas é isso esse jogo para mim é 10/10 e recomendo muito a qualquer a jogar isto.

Sound design and music are peak. Absolutely love the music in this game. Its so calming and nice.

very immersive and cool go buy it







One time I was going to an Arby's, and I saw Toad drinking a coke at one of the tables. I was far too anxious to approach him myself, however saw me looking and waved me over. I strolled over to the table and reached for my phone to snap a picture, feeling joyful that he was so friendly and open to fans. With a swift movement, he latched onto my wrist as tight as possible, and grinning ear to ear, broke my wrist in 6 places. Before I could scream out in agony, he started waterboarding me with his coke and napkins and began pelting me with punches to the ribs, his dark, soulless eyes staring deep into my soul. He never spoke a word, just silently beat, scratched, and tortured me in that Arby's. Once he stopped, I felt something carving into my head, but I was far too exhausted to even let out but a whimper. He kicked me in the ribs one final time, spitting on my limp, frail body and left me solitary as I was curled in fetal position, sobbing silently. I slowly crawled back home and stood slowly, looking in the mirror. "BUP" was scrawled on my forehead in bloody, blocky letters.

Rain World is a one of a kind gaming experience. You are thrown into a lush, beautiful yet uncaring and unfair world to fend for yourself as a small creature near the bottom of the food chain.
You will be eaten, speared, drowned and electrocuted. It will be unfair, it will be hard fought and it will be DELIGHTFUL. Because sometimes, SOMETIMES you pull through. You fend off the predators, pull off some difficult platforming or get to the safety of your shelter in the last second.
And it was you who did it. The game doesn't pull it's punches, so when you triumph it's all you. The game doesn't just teach you how to survive, it teaches you how to thrive.

184691164.review:
This game is bad. I wanted to love it. I wanted to feel challenged by the skill factor. I've become absorbed in so many other difficult games. But this game isn't really difficult. It's just arbitrary. Cryptic hidden movesets that don't really reveal themselves to you. Totally arbitrary gates that simply require regular grinding to pass. Timer based deaths unless you make it to the distant/scattered save points. The devs/fans keep wanting to call it a 'survival' game but it's not. The survival elements are simply tacked on. It's actually just a bad metroivania wiht no leveling or discovered abilities. No story at all and sorry no this is not like hollow knight with an env told story. At some point you just realize yup... this is all the game actually is... punish yourself trudging through the seemingly procedurally generated repetitive zones or quit. The controls are all sluggish but like... there's cryptical 'moves' you can sort of discover and they half tell you. But like elitists a bunch of the actually cool/useful ones are frame perfect moves. Ugh. It's just a great game executed poorly and that's the shame of it.

And yea I get it. You're insanely under powered cuz it's a survival game. You're a slugcat their invented weakling. Your mission is to aimlessly wander about till you find things that are interesting. But the levels are freaking enormous and the map system only really shows the small area you're in. So it's difficult to really track where you are or where you go. There's an annoying worm thingy that kind of gives you hints but is totally inconsistent. You see visions of things for a few seconds you're supposed to learn from but they're also super crytpic and unhelpful. Eventually after so many deaths they just start telling you in text what to do. And then there's endless items that have special uses but you have to figure them out cuz it's not like they're going to give you any tutorials. Just cryptic crap.

I played Stray right before this which was loosely going on the same theme and man this just does not work. Yes I got better. Yes I could progress. No it wasn't enjoyable. They literally add cheats to the game you can enable to make the game fun for people. There's very little to learn unless you look up guides/videos. The things you learn are bland like oh man if you turn and jump you do a flip!!! But it's not very useful. Totally defined by it's flaws. Waste of your time. Don't buy.

184579784.review: In terms of creating a world that shows how petty and unimportant the player character is, this game really deserves an award. The element of not leading the player by the hand and forcing them to discover things on their own, whether they affect the gameplay a little or a lot, also makes this game unique in a way. It creates a game that sets the player engaging, challenging tasks, but also sometimes impossible due to randomness. I have no idea if some of the things in this game were so poorly done, or if they were done on purpose to simply convey more of the game's atmosphere of unpredictability and brutality. Despite this, Rain World took several tries to draw me in enough to purchase the dlc after finishing the main campaigns, which, compared to the basic game, is larger and much more interesting. Its only drawback was also greater than the base, the amount of nerves it provided me with. I also have mixed feelings about the soundtrack, some tracks literally pull you out to dance, some do a great job of capturing the atmosphere, and a few others don't. The plot is not the forefront of this game, but it is interesting. The review is given as positive, because despite its many flaws, the idea and execution was original enough to provide many hours of great fun. I would happily play the sequel.

「おすすめしない」という評価をしましたが正確に言うと好みが分かれる作品だという印象を受けました。
序盤のみをプレイした感想ですが「安全な場所を探せ」という目的だけを伝えられ、後は広大で移動にも手間がかかるフィールドをヒントも無く彷徨い、雨や敵にやられてまた最初からやり直しという事を数回繰り返したところでストレスを感じ、私の好みではないと判断して失礼ながら返品をさせていただきました。
何度も失敗しながら徐々にコツを掴んでゲームを進めるタイプの、俗にいう「死にゲー」は嫌いではないのですがこのゲームは失敗するまでのスパンが長く感じる為に「次はもっと上手くやろう」と思うよりも「面倒くさい」という気持ちの方が勝ってしまいました。
好奇心が強くて何が何でも物語の結末を見てみたいと思う人や、何もヒントが無くても手探りでゲームを進める事を楽しめる方には向いている作品だと思います。

First of all, let me just say that if you are prone to rage-quitting and are not atleast a little bit patient, this game is not going to be fun for you.

This is literally the best game I've ever played. I'm not saying that like "oh this game is so good", I am saying it like it is. It is the BEST game I have EVER played. The game is a fun challenge, and the gameplay loop is almost seamless.

If you love combat, sure, Rain World has that. If you love survival, sure, Rain World IS that. If you love running away and yelling "PLEASE NO", sure, Rain World will make you go through that.

All in all, this game is really memorable. One thing to note, though. This game is LONG. It's long even without the Downpour DLC. Hell, most of my hours on this game are on ONE campaign! Now, either that's because I was terrible in the first half of my experience, or because tihs game is just long. I assume it to be the latter.

Please do try this game out. It's much too underrated, and critics rate it poorly. I hope you'll enjoy it!

184482326.review:
Rain World es un juego de genero supervivencia en el que su principal función es explorar y aprender de tu entorno para poder sobrevivir correctamente, para resumir de que va el juego es en que se basa que nos muestra la vida de una familia de especia de Gatobabosas que viven su vida de lo mas normal, cazando, explorando, ETC, pero por azares del destino uno de los miembros de la familia es separado por una tormentosa lluvia, de la cual logra sobrevivir y queda en un lugar inexplorado lleno de lugares peligroso y criaturas hostiles, embarcando nos en una aventura por reencontrarnos con la familia nuevamente, les puedo ir avisando que el juego es bastante difícil, siendo un juego que te lleva al ensayo y error, y también ir aprendiendo por tu propia cuenta y con un poquito de ayuda para ir aprendiendo del juego y convivir en tu entorno que te rodea, el juego nunca te dice nada explicita mente de manera textual, pero si te lo dice con símbolos e imágenes que puedes asimilar y entender lo que tratan de decirte, un juego que sinceramente vale la pena jugarlo si te gustan los juegos difíciles, visualmente puedo decir que es algo simplemente hermoso y precioso de ver, pero que esa preciosidad no te engañe de la cantidad de peligros que puedes encontrar en tu aventura.

Como una recomendación les diría que si pueden junto al juego base consigan el DLC Downpour, no digo que necesariamente lo consigan junto al juego base, aunque si quieren pueden hacerlo, la razón por la que lo digo es porque muy seguramente les tome mucho tiempo el completar siquiera la primera campaña del juego, y el DLC añade mas tipos de gatobabosas con sus habilidades únicas con su campaña diferente e historia diferente, un juego ciertamente bastante bueno para ir re jugandolo varias veces por la cantidad de caminos que puedes encontrar, y si no se les es suficiente, tengan en cuenta que el juego tiene soporte para mods, y pueden encontrar diversos mods tanto que les pueda servir en la aventura, como expandir mas las horas de juego con nuevas zonas por explorar o modos de juego hechas por fans de este hermoso juego.

这游戏算是我最喜欢的一款,玩法有点类似于空洞骑士和死亡细胞，在游戏你将操作一只蛞蝓猫在复杂、庞大和恶劣的生态环境中生存，而且看起来蛞蝓猫处于食物链的最低端(至少我玩起来是这样)。所以一开始你肯定会摸不着头脑，不过不要紧，多死几次就好了。
        在游戏中有一些非常隐晦的剧情，蛞蝓猫在这里探索的目的与这些隐藏故事密切相关，如果你想要打通关可能需要在网上寻找一些攻略。当然，抓几只烦人的乌贼飞跃楼层间或者搭上鲑鱼的快车在水里畅游，没事欣赏欣赏背景墙也是不错的选择。另外需要说明一件事是不要等着去看下雨的场景，否则你就会看到你令你难忘的一幕(doge)
       虽然我的steam在线时长只有20个小时左右，但是之前已经通过某些手段玩到了这款游戏，总的游戏时长差不多有100个小时左右，然而还是没能打通主线剧情，我认为我总的游戏时长应该会有150小时，当然，你应该可以玩的更久。
        然后是最近出了一个新的mod,你也可以在雨世界中和朋友联机了，快进游戏欺负你朋友吧。

    This game is one of my favorite,  similar to Hollow Knights and Dead Cells. In the game, you will operate a slug cat to survive in a complex, massive, and harsh ecological environment, and it seems that the slug cat is at the bottom of the food chain (at least that's how I play it). So at first, you may not be able to figure it out, but it's okay, just die a few more times.
    There are some very subtle stories in the game, and the purpose of Slug Cat's exploration here is closely related to these hidden stories. If you want to clear the level, you may need to search for some strategies online. Of course, catching a few annoying squid to leap between floors or taking a fast salmon ride to swim in the water is also a good choice to appreciate the background wall when you have nothing to do. Another thing to note is not to wait to see a rainy scene, otherwise you will see a scene that you will never forget (doge)Although my Steam online time is only about 20 hours, I have already played this game through some means before, and the total game time is about 100 hours. However, I still couldn't get through the main story line. I think my total game time should be 150 hours, of course, you should be able to play for longer.Then there's a new mod recently, you can also connect with friends online in Rain World, fast forward to the game and bully your friends.Finally, I'll send you a emoji, but I don't know if it can be posted on Steam (no matter what). 184388556.review:
(this review has been written before I have finished the game)
Rain world, oh god.
I love this game so much, I used to have a love and hate relationship but then I decided to just do research
and I fell in a big rabbit hole and suddenly understood everything, 
this game is genuinely so fun to pick up and play.
Seeing the wildlife exist and interact, while I try to do my own thing - trying to avoid death by running or attacking them, trying my best to fend them off 
I thrive in the enviroment of the game, I feel like I belong.
I don't know how to explain really

I can understand why people may dislike this game, but this game wasn't built for the everyday casual gamer, but moreso those who deeply care about the art of the game, and the world that has been built, and no, I'm not gatekeeping; anyone can enjoy the game, but you are most likely to enjoy this game if you are passionate of games as art, not a product - not something to waste time, but to explore and learn from.
this game by itself is poetry and I'm glad its gotten the recognition it deserves

I have gotten the DLC, despite not even finishing the main game (and plan to get the watcher dlc when it comes out)

I'll update this review when I have experienced everything this game has to offer, well most things <3

184388371.review:
很好玩，但想入坑的玩家要慎重考虑。
先说缺点：
1，缺少引导，新手教程太少了，不知道自己要干什么，必须得自己摸索。
2，剧情稀碎，只有偶尔几个画面，实在是难以理解，打了6个小时好不容易推了点剧情，然后就没有然后了。
3，难，太难了，有时候经常被卡在一处半天，等级直接一降到底，而且有时候食物还不够，而且还有时间限制（下雨），总而言之就是心态崩了。
4，没有成长，主角从始至终都弱到离谱，被各种怪物花式爆杀，唯一的成就感可能就来自成就系统吧。
再说优点：
1，生态系统真的无敌，每一个生物都有自己的想法，甚至还有食物链，算是赛博生态箱了。
2，美术是我喜欢的风格，复古废土风，好像还有点像素风格（看宣传片），而且说实话怪物挺帅的。
3，如果你细细研究剧情，真的有很多启发，具体不剧透了。
总而言之推荐尝试，整体偏魂系，很硬核，但很好玩。

184374491.review:
-Very out there story and lore inspired by various different irl cultures
-unique gameplay which is a mix of survival and exploration
-cool procedurally animated creatures
-lots of lore to find
-looks pretty
-deep movement system which is entirely optional to get into
-very moddable

Despite what some (liars) might say, this game isn't an ecosystem game, it just gives the illusion of one, creature spawns are fixed with the only exception being lineaging

Negatives:
-creatures often get stuck
-stupid static camera which means you can't see much during screen transitions and creatures can attack from offscreen
-unfair deaths can happen: gettting attacked from offscreen, creature blocking your only path, neutral Scav deciding to attack for no reason, etc

Don't buy the DLC though, it wasn't made by the devs and it's the worst of fanon

184314973.review:
Абсолютна перлина.

Ця гра не для всіх. Вона куди більше про процес і взаємодію систем, ніж про досягнення і кінцеву мету. Це мандрівка, а не подорож. Кінцева точка існує, але більшу частину часу ви не будете знати, що це за точка, і де саме вона знаходиться. Ви будете рухатися вперед, до невідомого. І це приведе вас... неважливо куди. Це вестиме вас далі.

Опис "Rain World" починається з фрази, що купила мене повністю: "Ви -- слимакіт".

Слимакошеня, будучи точним. І єдине що хоче робити з цією інформацією гра -- змусити вас прожити це на повну. Страх перед хижаками, відчуття постійного переслідування, дивний світ, який ви ніколи не бачили, дивні створіння з якими можна взаємодіяти, перетікаюча інерція руху, а також шалена доза дослідження... всього.

Кошеня не знає нічого ні про свої можливості, ні про оточення, ні про цілі. Але йому доведеться у всьому розібратися. З вашою допомогою. Готуйтеся часто не розуміти що робити і дивуватися як дитя, знайшовши це розуміння.

Шикарний візуал, шикарний звук, шикарний геймплей. Що ще потрібно для гри ціною в 2 шаурми* у Steam? 

P.S. Бажано "друге дно", або ж "глибокий сенс". І його. тут. є. 

P.P.S. Доповнення Downpour робить гру ще глибшою і крутішою, додаючи безліч можливостей у цю й без того фантастичну пісочницю. Вартує кожної копійки.

184269361.review:
This review doesn't have any (major) spoilers for Rain World, don't worry.

Let me be honest here: This game is very hard for beginners. You're given a very BRIEF tutorial and then expected to spontaneously gain 600 IQ. However, it's very worth it to stay because of how rewarding it feels to find out how the enemies with you, and how the enemies interact with each other as well. Not only that, but you can also discover certain shortcuts that are basically bypassing a harder route. It also has a fun "hit and run" combat system and the Expedition mode that comes with Downpour (DLC) is also fun, adding a lot of replayability and interaction with the wildlife and close-to-human locals.

I kid you not though, do not eat any white things that float in groups of up to 5 or more, they are not important-For you, at least.
